intro: Malesherbia mendocina, commonly known as the Mendoza malesherbia, is a flowering plant native to Argentina. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural study and ecological research.
